lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether JPMorgan Chase adequately disclosed to investors that a hedge fund had a role in selecting the pieces of a 2007 collateralized debt obligation, Jesse Eisinger and Jake Bernstein of ProPublica report, citing "people familiar with the probe."
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether JPMorgan Chase adequately disclosed to investors that a hedge fund had a role in selecting the pieces of a 2007 collateralized debt obligation, ProPublica reports.

headline.main: S.E.C. Said to Examine JPMorgan Over C.D.O.

abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether JPMorgan Chase adequately disclosed to investors that a hedge fund had a role in selecting the pieces of a 2007 collateralized debt obligation, ProPublica reports.
